La Fondation Louis D. attribue chaque année un Grand Prix scientifique de 750 000 euros, pour aider des laboratoires ou des équipes de recherche dans leurs travaux à caractère fondamental ou appliqué. Il est ouvert chaque année alternativement à la compétition internationale ou française. En 2012 ce Prix avait pour thème : "Études de propriétés remarquables de la matières liées à la cohérence quantique". Philippe Bouyer et Christophe Salomon sont les lauréats du Prix scientifique 2012 de la Fondation Louis D. Prix Jean Jerphagnon December 2009 http://www.prixjeanjerphagnon.org/index.html 
 
Ce prix veut honorer la mémoire et prolonger l’œuvre de Jean Jerphagnon, décédé en 2005, qui mena une carrière remarquable dans le domaine de l’optique et de la photonique. Il a pour objectif de promouvoir l’innovation technologique et la diffusion de l'optique et de la photonique dans tout domaine d’application. Fellow of the American Physical Society www.aps.org January 2015 Additional Honors & Awards 2010 : Laureate of OSEO prize for innovation technology 
2009 : Fulbright fellowship 
2009 : Jean Jerphagnon prize for innovation 
2009 : Research prize from iXCore foundation 
2004 : Fabry-de Gramont prize from French Optical Society 
2000 : J. Herbrand prize from l’Académie des Sciences 
1996 : Lavoisier Post-Doctoral fellowship. 
1996 : DGA Post-Doctoral fellowship 
1993 : Max Plank Insitüt für KernPhysik visiting fellow (Heidelberg) 
1991-1994 : CNRS Ph.D. fellowship Grand prix scientifique de la fondation Louis D Institut de France June 2012 http://grands-prix-2012.institut-de-france.fr/philippe-bouyer

http://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pubmed/ Experience Post-doctoral Fellow Stanford University September 2008  – Present (7 years) I am investigating interactions between the immune system and the brain in Alzheimer's Disease and Frontotemporal Dementia. I want to understand how the immune response changes disease onset and progression and how we can modulate it towards a beneficial outcome in patients.

Czirr E, Fukuhara T, Narasimhan R, Johns H, Adame A, Britschgi M, Masliah E, Wyss-Coray T Graduate Student Johannes Gutenberg-University Mainz 2004  –  2008  (4 years) Mainz Area, Germany During my Ph.D. with Dr. Weggen at the Universities of Mainz and Duesseldorf I investigated the effects of familial mutations in presenilin on the efficacy and mechanism of action of gamma-secretase modulators and inhibitors. I was able to determine that mutations in presenilin can lead to dramatic changes in EC50 for both inhibitors and modulators of gamma-secretase. This is of importance as similar compounds are in clinical trials for the treatment of Alzheimer’s disease (AD) and mouse models carrying these mutations are used in pre-clinical drug development. 
 
Oral presentations at international meetings: 
 
Influence of FAD PS1 mutations on the efficacy of γ-secretase modulators and inhibitors: evidence for independent generation of Aβ42 and Aβ38 peptide species. 
Society for Neuroscience 2007; November 3-7, 2007; San Diego, CA, USA

Summary I am a scientist and mentor who is passionate about research, education, and promoting the success of future science enthusiasts. As a researcher, I have used biochemistry and genetics to explore the function of protein complexes that regulate DNA accessibility and repair. As an educator and mentor, I strive to devise ways of conveying science using multiple learning strategies (e.g. problem-based learning), as well as invest in student professional development by helping them identify and effectively utilize resources that will assist them in their chosen career path. Dr. Lachmi worked as a neuroscientist and researcher at Stanford and originally earned a Ph.D. working on brain cancer at Tel Aviv University. Karin served 2 years in the Israeli Air Force. Experience Founder and CSO Bioz, Inc. July 2013  – Present (2 years 2 months) San Francisco Bay Area Bioz is a bio/IT start-up that has developed a platform for scientific researchers to make better decisions when planning their next experiment. The comprehensive cloud-based NLP data-mining application facilitates quick and easy search, to identify the most relevant reagents and associated insights. Bioz’s platform incorporates full-text analysis with relevancy ranking of results, research-relevant correlations, reagent product ratings, and researcher collaboration optimization. All reagent insights are unique, and are mined from millions of objective peer-reviewed scientific articles. By using Bioz, scientists are able to reduce the cost of reagents, shorten the amount of time required for successful experimentation, and most importantly, improve the quality of their research. Bioz will revolutionize how scientists do science.

Pre Doctoral Fellow ICGEB August 2007  –  July 2012  (5 years) My graduate studies have been on the project "​ Role of prostaglandins in the modulation of T cell responses". 
•	Investigated mechanisms of action of prostaglandins in the modulation of T cell immune responses- Identified PGE2 receptor EP2 as a critical druggable target for selective inhibition of cell death in Th2 cells in tuberculosis (TB) infection. 
I have worked on Activation Induced Cell Death mechanisms (AICD) of CD4+ T cells and the role of Prostaglandin E2 receptors (G-protein coupled-receptors) in AICD and T cell differentiation. Two model systems were used to validate the hypotheses : Allergic Airway inflammation (AAI ) and Tuberculosis. 
 
 Masters Student University of Delhi 2005  –  2007  (2 years) •	Synthesized a novel anti-hyperlipidemic Bis[3-(4'-bromophenyl)prop-2-ene] disulphide derivative of diallyldisulphide analogs (DADS) and identified its mechanism of action (targets HMG-CoA reductase activity by inhibiting the DNA binding of co-regulatory transcription factors CREB and NF-Y to promoter region of HMG-CoA reductase).  
•	Evaluated the antimicrobial activity of the essential oils of Geranium (Pelargonium graveolens) and Ajowan (Carum ajowan) on three bacterial pathogens and compared with first-line antibiotic therapeutic regimen.  
 
Major topics: Immunology, Microbiology, Pharmacology, Toxicology, Human Physiology, Biochemistry, Medicinal Chemistry, Genetics, Bio-statistics, Bio-informatics.
